intro: Tibouchina breedlovei, commonly known as the Hawaiian tibouchina, is a shrub native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and coastal areas. It has elliptical to ovate leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, berry-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
